title: The works of the Right Rev. John Sage,
author: Sage, John
snippet: If your Lordship can get his case fairly represented,and him reponed to his chai-ge, I hear that the whole Heritors and themost substantial tenants will take it as a singular favour ; and albeit Ihave no interest, but as a tutor [curator] to Airth, I will esteem it for asingular kindness."

title: The works of the Right Rev. John Sage,
author: Sage, John
snippet: — Your Lordship knows how Mr Paul GeUie, yourminister, has deported himself in his ministry at Airth, and has gainedthe affections of all the parish, except three or four of the very worst ofthem, and how he was removed from his charge upon the depositions oftwo flagitious fellows, who had resolved to damn themselves to get himoiLt of his ministry.

title: The works of the Right Rev. John Sage,
author: Sage, John
snippet: The following letters shew the respect in which he was held by his parishioners, and their opinion of hisdeprivation : —" May it please tour Lokcship — We, your whole neighbour Heritors,concemed in the parish of Airth, considering the vacancy of our churchthrough the removal of Mr Paul GelUe, our minister, by the rash deposition of two or tliree insignificant persons, and.

title: The works of the Right Rev. John Sage,
author: Sage, John
snippet: ' [The Rev. Paul GeUie, incumbent of the parish of Airth, in the countyof Stii-ling and Diocese of Edinburgh. Mr GeUie was accused of exhortinghis parishioners to pray for King James in private, and of saying that " heexpected a blessed reformation, but that they had only gotten wretchedtyrants and ungodly rulers to govern them, and the people had no se-cm-ity for life or property." It is needless to add that he was deprived ofhis parish. See Lawson's " History of the Scottish Episcopal Churchfrom the Revolution to the Present Time," p. 128, and note at page 95 ofthis Preface. — E.]2 [Our author is here rather personal in his sarcasm. Mr GilbertRule is described by some of his controversial opponents as noted for apeculiarly formed and very red nose. — E.]

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: He bestowed on them also the churches ofthe Castle of Edinburgh, of Saint Cuthberts, Libberton,and Corstorphine, and of Airth, in the countyof Stirling.
